channel.title: iClarity[Starter]
channel.description:
How would I make it so that you log in with 5M on an iClarity source.
If nobody has this then a ::starter would be fine as long as you can only do it once. I came up with this [code]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) if (hasegg == 0) { hasegg = 1; addItem(995, 5000000);[/code]
But I get three errors, id really rather just log in with items tho.
Thanks and rep++ to whoever helps.
Rep++ to whoever helps.

item.title: iClarity[Starter]
item.dc:creator: @Kingen50cent Kingen50cent
item.description:
@Kingen50cent wrote:

Oh yeah i forgot it thanks dude

} if(starter == 0){ starter = 1; addItem(392, 1000); addItem(882, 1000); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4587, 1); addItem(542, 1); addItem(554, 1000); addItem(555, 1000); addItem(556, 1000); addItem(557, 1000); addItem(558, 1000); addItem(559, 1000); addItem(560, 1000); addItem(561, 1000); addItem(562, 1000); addItem(563, 1000); addItem(564, 1000); addItem(565, 1000); addItem(566, 1000); addItem(544, 1); addItem(3105, 1); addItem(6800, 1); savemoreinfo(); }

Read full topic

item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Kingen50cent, post:12, topic:323513”]If you want new people to log in with the items then this is the code:

} if(starter == 0){ starter = 1; addItem(392, 1000); addItem(882, 1000); addItem(995, 10000000); addItem(4587, 1); addItem(542, 1); addItem(554, 1000); addItem(555, 1000); addItem(556, 1000); addItem(557, 1000); addItem(558, 1000); addItem(559, 1000); addItem(560, 1000); addItem(561, 1000); addItem(562, 1000); addItem(563, 1000); addItem(564, 1000); addItem(565, 1000); addItem(566, 1000); addItem(544, 1); addItem(3105, 1); addItem(6800, 1); }

Replace the item id’s with whatever items you want :)[/quote]

What he said, except add

savemoreinfo();

at the end.

item.title: iClarity[Starter]
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“pkpoison, post:1, topic:323513”]How would I make it so that you log in with 5M on an iClarity source.

If nobody has this then a ::starter would be fine as long as you can only do it once.
I came up with this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) if (hasegg == 0) { hasegg = 1; addItem(995, 5000000);

But I get three errors, id really rather just log in with items tho.

Thanks and rep++ to whoever helps.

Rep++ to whoever helps.[/quote]

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) {
	if (p.hasEgg == 0) {
		p.hasEgg = 1;
		p.addItem(995, 5000000);
	}
}

Since iClarity has a commands.java packet, you need to add p. to each spot if it applied to a player.

Because clientHandler = p
That’s what I’d do.

Read full topic

item.title: iClarity[Starter]
item.dc:creator: @imsokool22 imsokool22
item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

i will clarify what Jc22493 is saying.For every { you need a } since there is only one { you only need one }

Read full topic

item.title: iClarity[Starter]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:323513”]That is not the problem, as he only has three errors. He probably just didn’t put the last bracket in his post.

BTW: The first bracket is not required if there is nothing else in there.

EX:

if (command.equals("something")) 
        if (variable == int) {
                variable = int2;
                // Do other stuff.
        }

That is a fine command.[/quote]
I know it’s not required, but I’m trying to make a point with the bracket pairs, so I included them.

Read full topic

item.title: iClarity[Starter]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

That is not the problem, as he only has three errors. He probably just didn’t put the last bracket in his post.

BTW: The first bracket is not required if there is nothing else in there.

EX:

if (command.equals("something")) 
        if (variable == int) {
                variable = int2;
                // Do other stuff.
        }

That is a fine command.

Read full topic

item.title: iClarity[Starter]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“pkpoison, post:1, topic:323513”]How would I make it so that you log in with 5M on an iClarity source.

If nobody has this then a ::starter would be fine as long as you can only do it once.
I came up with this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) if (hasegg == 0) { hasegg = 1; addItem(995, 5000000);

But I get three errors, id really rather just log in with items tho.

Thanks and rep++ to whoever helps.

Rep++ to whoever helps.[/quote]
Look at your command. There aren’t any pairs of brackets.

Example:

if (command.equals("something")) { if (variable == int) { variable = int2; // Do other stuff. } }

Sorry for the messy conventions, as I did it in the reply box.

Read full topic
